image.altText: Campers being rescued in flood water.

props.synopsis: The new year has got off to a dramatic start in northern New South Wales with heavy rain causing waterways across the Tweed to break their banks overnight.

title.children: Campers plucked from floodwaters as heavy rain hits the Tweed

image.altText: Photo illustration of a page from a January calendar and cars entering tunnel to the right

props.synopsis: The $60 weekly toll cap was an election promise from the now Minns government, aimed at targeting cost of living concerns.

title.children: A new toll cap takes effect in Sydney today. How will it change the cost of your journey?

image.altText: Howard Bush

props.synopsis: The confidentiality period of cabinet documents from 2003 expires, revealing some of the deliberations of the then-Howard government — though the most sensitive discussions remain secret.

title.children: Previously secret 2003 cabinet documents reveal high-level conversations prior to Australia joining Iraq War

image.altText: rohan dennis wife 3

props.synopsis: Internationally renowned cyclist and former Tour Down Under winner Rohan Dennis has been charged over the New Year's Eve death of his wife, two-time Olympian Melissa Hoskins.

title.children: Cycling community in shock after Olympian's death, with world champion husband charged

image.altText: Princess Mary walks with Frederik and Queen Margrethe

props.synopsis: Denmark's Queen Margrethe II will abdicate after 52 years on the throne and will be succeeded by her eldest son Crown Prince Frederik and Princess Mary.

title.children: Princess Mary to become Queen of Denmark as monarch announces surprise abdication

image.altText: A man puts her arm around the shoulders of a young woman, both of them with dark hair.

props.synopsis: Mary Donaldson grew up in suburban Hobart and went to her local high school. Later this month, she'll become Denmark's queen when her husband, Frederik, becomes king.

title.children: When Frederik met Mary: How a 'secret' Tasmanian girl rose to win 'the hearts of the Danes'

image.altText: a close-up image of a woman's hand holding a vape. smoke can be seen coming from her nose and moutn

props.synopsis: We've officially made it through to another year. Here's a quick breakdown of some of the changes to expect.

title.children: Vaping ban and Centrelink payment increases among January 1 changes

image.altText: A lightning strikes land on the Sunshine Coast

props.synopsis: A severe thunderstorm warning for the already-battered Gold Coast area has been cancelled, but the threat of isolated heavy rainfall remains in place for much of south-east Queensland on New Year's Day.

title.children: More than 100mm of rain recorded in just two hours as Queensland's south-east struggles to catch a break from severe weather

image.altText: A Volunteer Marine Rescue vessel in Gold Coast waters

props.synopsis: Police allege a skipper blew almost three times the legal limit while more than 100 passengers were on-board celebrating New Year's Eve.

title.children: Allegedly drunk skipper one of '620 idiots' police caught drunk behind the wheel

image.altText: A back and white photo of Eric Jacobi.

props.synopsis: Eric Stanley Jacobi was sentenced to death for murder, but he escaped the hangman thanks to a secret medical report that was hidden from the public for 75 years.

title.children: He committed a savage murder but for reasons kept secret until now, Eric Jacobi was spared from execution

image.altText: cut outs of Britney SPears, King CHarles, Alan Joyce and the Matildas on a blue background

props.synopsis: 2023 may feel like it stretched on for a decade, but it really was only 12 months! Can you answer all our questions about last year's biggest stories and key moments correctly?

title.children: Think you remember everything that happened last year? Test yourself with our 2023 mega-quiz

image.altText: A woman in a headscarf carries bags through the rubble of a destroyed building

props.synopsis: Since October 7, fear abounds among both Israelis and Palestinians. Now there are two major questions being discussed in Israel, writes John Lyons.

title.children: The two major questions being discussed in Israel as the Gaza war rages on

image.altText: An old building with damage to it. A fire truck is outside with a crane over the building.

props.synopsis: Russia launches a fresh drone assault on Ukraine as Vladimir Putin makes only a passing reference to the war in his New Year address.

title.children: Russia launches fresh strikes on Ukraine as Putin addresses 'difficult problem' in New Year speech

image.altText: A wave with blue luminescent light rolling into the shore.

props.synopsis: A night-time spectacle in waters off the New South Wales mid north coast and Sydney delights many this Christmas-New Year holiday period.

title.children: Missed the fireworks? Bioluminescence along NSW beaches is 'even better' and it's happening now

image.altText: The back of a police officer looking towards damaged and overturned carriages

props.synopsis: Police have charged a 75-year-old truck driver from Queensland over Sunday's horrific rail collision at a Barrier Highway crossing, near the SA-NSW border, that killed two train workers from Port Augusta.

title.children: Truck driver charged over freight train crash that killed two workers near SA-NSW border

image.altText: A chimpanzee, next to a man in a hat and a woman wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Remakes and reboots have been around forever and it doesn't look like they are going away anytime soon. But do audiences actually want them or is it just Hollywood's way of making a quick buck?

title.children: Hunting profits or serving an audience? Why Hollywood is obsessed with remakes

image.altText: A hand holding a purple vape, Bunbury tower in the background

props.synopsis: New national regulations taking effect today will make it illegal to buy disposable vapes from overseas, irrespective of their nicotine content or therapeutic claims, while doctors will be able to prescribe therapeutic vapes to be bought through pharmacies.

title.children: A national crackdown on disposable vapes begins today. How will it work?

image.altText: picture of a child standing in front of graves in Gaza

props.synopsis: Israeli strikes in central Gaza kill at least 35 more people, hospital officials said, as fighting raged across the tiny enclave a day after Israel's prime minister said the war will continue for "many more months," resisting international calls for a cease-fire.

title.children: War in Gaza will continue for months, says Netanyahu as intensified Israeli air raids kill 35 more people in Gaza

image.altText: A spectacular view of Sydney Harbour shows the Opera House and Harbour Bridge illuminated by golden fireworks.

props.synopsis: After many hours of preparation (and days of camping out, for some), thousands take part in festivities around the country.

title.children: Thousands gather for New Year's Eve fireworks at events across Australia

image.altText: Fireworks explode over the skyline of Jakarta

props.synopsis: Organisers worldwide have readied for large-scale New Year's Eve celebrations, offering a hopeful start to 2024 even as the globe's ongoing conflicts raised concerns.

title.children: How the world celebrated ringing in 2024 for New Year's Eve

image.altText: A cricketer celebrates hitting a century

props.synopsis: Ahead of his final Test match, Australian opener David Warner has announced he will also retire from one-day international cricket.

title.children: David Warner announces retirement from one-day international cricket

image.altText: A soccer coach is shown a yellow card by a referee

props.synopsis: He picked up a yellow card along the way, but Ange Postecoglou's Spurs have brushed aside an in-form Bournemouth side to close in on the Premier League lead while north London rivals Arsenal crashed to an unexpected defeat.

title.children: Ange Postecoglou yellow-carded as Spurs edge within three points of Premier League summit following latest win

image.altText: A photo of a middle-aged man standing outdoors in the sun near a damaged building.

props.synopsis: Pilger's family announced his death on social media, saying his "journalism and documentaries were celebrated around the world".

title.children: Veteran Australian journalist and documentary-maker John Pilger dies aged 84

image.altText: A close up of a middle-aged white woman with straight hair to her chin speaking at a microphoned lecturn. A man behind her

props.synopsis: Shenna Bellows says she has no doubts the incident stemmed from her decision to remove Mr Trump from the state of Maine's presidential primary ballot.

title.children: US state official who removed Donald Trump from ballot targeted in 'swatting' call

image.altText: A home stands destroyed on a hill top.

props.synopsis: Tensions in one storm-impacted community bubble over as Queensland's deputy premier is ambushed by angry residents.

title.children: 'We need help now': Power restoration efforts hampered by more storms in south-east Queensland

image.altText: An ambulance travels on a road near a packed park in the afternoon.

props.synopsis: A boy and a girl, both aged under 10, are found floating in the river at Burswood in Perth and are taken to hospital, but are unable to be saved.

title.children: 'Panic and chaos': Two young children dead after being pulled from Perth's Swan River on New Year's Eve

image.altText: A prop car in a forest

props.synopsis: Thousands of tickets have already been sold for an outdoor Harry Potter event at a nature park south of Melbourne, which residents fear will pose a danger to local wildlife.

title.children: Council defends 'Forbidden Forest' Harry Potter experience after thousands sign petition to move event

image.altText: Side photo of Queensland police car.

props.synopsis: A QAS spokesperson said emergency services performed CPR, but the child was in a critical condition and could not be revived.

title.children: Two-year-old girl dies after being found unconscious in hot car at Eungella, west of Mackay

image.altText: A close-up view of Maersk shipping containers.

props.synopsis: Global shipping company Maersk says it will pause all sailing through the Red Sea for 48 hours in response to the attack.

title.children: US Navy helicopters repel Houthi attack on container ship in Red Sea
